meanings.definition: The purpose or role of something.
meanings.sent1: The function of a hammer is to drive nails.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the function of a heart is crucial for medical students.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the function of the music was to keep everyone dancing.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the function of the narrator was like a guiding light for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The function of a map is to help you find your way.

meanings.definition: A mathematical relationship between two sets of variables.
meanings.sent1: The function in the equation represents the relationship between x and y.
meanings.sent2: Studying functions in math class can be challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The function of the graph was to show the correlation between the data points.
meanings.sent4: In calculus, understanding functions is key to solving complex problems.
meanings.sent5: The function of the formula is to calculate the unknown variable.

meanings.definition: To work or operate in a specified way.
meanings.sent1: The machine will function properly if you follow the instructions.
meanings.sent2: Plants function by converting sunlight into energy through photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The team will function better if everyone communicates effectively.
meanings.sent4: Without water, the body cannot function optimally.
meanings.sent5: To function efficiently, the computer needs regular maintenance.

meanings.sent1: The charity function raised funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent2: Attending a function at the embassy can be a great networking opportunity.
meanings.sent3: The school function was a fun way to celebrate the end of the year.
meanings.sent4: The annual function at the company is always a highlight for employees.
meanings.sent5: The function at the park brought the community together for a day of fun.
